reviews.text: To be honest it was very disappointing to see the conditions of this synagogue. Every country I go to, I make an effort to see the local synagogues and this has been my least favorite. It was interesting how there was a police man out front- made me question a few things . But the owners or whom ever is responsible for the upkeep of the holy place is allowing children to leave there trash/toys upstairs and IMO it wasn’t very presentable.
Worth reading  up on and visiting’ cheap stalls all around, somewhat isolated
Closed when we went by, but easy enough to find with the help of locals. I was happy to see another part of Fez, outside the Medina
Nothing much to see and very hostile doorgirl charing different race different entrance fee. Unpleasant.
1 of the most nice place i like it

A bar that offers happy hour in Fes, Morocco?  We had to check it out.

Great views of the garden on the terrace.  The cushions are a bit dirty and torn up but eh.  The service was slow but once it started to fill up, our server was around more.

The happy hour is kind of a joke.  Order 2 beers, get the 3rd free but only per person and they give you all 3 at the same time.

We enjoyed our evening of drinks and the best Hookah we’ve had so far in Morocco. This is the only ‘bar’ we found in the area.  Staff were really friendly and the wine was nice and cold. Shame we ran out of time and couldn’t make it back another night.
Nice location, more potential, alcohol available ;)

seems to be one of the few places to have a drink in Fes !  the prices are a little high but considering the alcohol shortage,  you cant complain.  They also have local Moroccan beer which is pretty good.
One of very little places you get an actual alcoholic drink and mine long island for 80dh was pretty juicy - read strong. Nice terrace on top, really cozy place.
Nice cozy family restaurant and delicious food!! Highly recommend!
Amazing dishes prepared with love from the Catalan owner are amazing! Very tasty, fresh and a good price. Is hidden and quite. We were very lucky to find it.

I have been in Fès for a month and have eaten at Fez Lounge four times already! The food is delicious and prices are very reasonable 
Don’t listen to people who tell you the street is closed if you try to get there. It is a quiet area and you will not regret going!
Good hospitality and ambiance. Overpriced food for what you get. Can get twice as much for same price with better quality.
This is a tourist trap. The food was expensive and tasteless. A very disapointing place. Also the music was loud, annoying and not typical at all.

Good burgers, interesting chocolate fondue drink.  Cheerful English speaking staff.  Lots of young tourists and travellers.  Went for lunch and dinner.  Good experience both times.  Has multiple stories to eat on.

Amazing jewel of a cafe, which we found thanks to a recommendation in the Lonely Planet guide. Google Maps was essential to find this treasure. Persevere and you won't be dissapointed. Ask to go to the terrace. Great people, food, drink and service. And if it wasn't enough, they also have interesting cultural activities.

Really excellent food and a great vibe! There are three floors, and the top two are definitely the place to be. We were lucky to get a table on the terrace (top floor) and have pleasant weather while we ate. They also have weekly events happening some evenings, so it can be a cool spot on any night of the week!
Tasty camel burger and great environment in the terrace. It may get busy, and difficult to find a shadowed table, but it is worth to try their food.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Came here on two occasions during our 7 day visit in Fez and the surroundings. It’s a much-welcome oasis among the chaos of the medina and the food is by far the most westernized you’ll find in any of the nearby restaurants, maybe even including the ones in the new city. All of the things we tried were good but I recommend ordering their vegetable quiche and their chocolate milkshake, they were both tasty comfort items. The minus one star rating is because their organization can be a bit scattered, especially when they have events.

It’s a huge, beautifully decorated property. Great wifi. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Gorgeous rooftop terrace.

Hotel is beautifully detailed. Staff and owner were fantastic! Very attentive, polite, and friendly! They continuously tried to make our time in Fes as easy and comfortable as possible, we got in late and they brought up fruit and cookies, or sent up soup because we were going to skip dinner due to timing. They helped find us a tour and made us little to-go bags with breakfast when we were departing before breakfast was being served.

The rooms are not modern but this is an old building in a historical part of the medina. It’s part of its charm. Beds were a tad firm, but it’s not a real concern, I still slept great.

We had spent our NYE there. The worst decision in my life. 
When you expect that they are preparing a feast for you, as you are paying 80€ per person, instead, you see that the part was made only for the owner’s family.
For 80€ we had per person: 
- A shared table with unknown people.
- A glass of water as entrance. Some of the guests had even a glass of orange juice. Uau!
- The cheapest Wine you can find in the supermarket. 
- A curious so-called salad mix that we had to share with another 6 people in the table. Together we had 1/4 of bread each. 
- A small kefta stick. The meat was old and tasteless. 
- A strange piece of whatever meat with tons of bones and fat. 
- A very hard and cold Pastilla. Don’t know how does it tastes. 
- Some strange and old dessert that I couldn’t even eat. 
PLUS: ONE GLASS OF CHAMPAGNE for the Turn. 

Also, the toilets are dirty and the tables super uncomfortable. 

When I complained about the situation The Owner told me that “this is the way it is” and I had just to swallow it to not mess up my NYE, as Fes and particularly the location of this Riad, is not a safe to walk around during the night. 

We had in our table a group of Dutch and Italian couples, who were also embarrassed and visibly uncomfortable with the situation. 

In the end we have decided to have fun of the situation due to the small capacity and knowledge of the owner who was clearly treating his employees like idiots. He was also filming everything with his phone and that also made us super uncomfortable (see the video I have posted). Also, as he was filming, we could not see the “entertainment” as he was in front of our sight. 

A strange dancer came in the room and tried to Entertain us dancing something I could not identify. She was clearly not a professional and danced like she was on a gentleman-club. 

Well. There are so many bad things to say about this place. 

I just feel sorry for the owner’s family and employees who have no options and have to stay there everyday. 

If you have a chance, don’t stay in this Riad. There are many and much better options in Fes. 

The location is also not good. Is very dangerous with lots of drug dealers around the big square that surround this Riad. 

Try to find something closer to the Blue Gate. Much safer and alive. 

In the end, I am not angry, I am just sad that this kind of people are making the beautiful city of Fes looking like a tourist trap. And indeed is. 

Tip for 2019: Don’t stay here at all.

Truly refined food and great service, wonderful hospitality and traditional live acoustic music by very talented musician. The view is priceless, Nice fire to keep you warm and create a lovely atmosphere on a cold winters day. One of my best experiences in Fes
The bathroom had a bad smell and no heating system. A fancy building but not a well arranged room

I have been Traveling in the last 7 years, and I would like to say that this Place is extremely Beautiful! Even more when you are here! Full of Colours, its people and weather...AMAZING!

Would you like to see more about all the places that I have been?
CHECK MY PROFILE!
Fantastic ice-cream dishes to suit all. Still good after 20 years
Top
Amazing Ice cream! Best one in town! :)
Best ice cream ever

Nichts weniger als sensationell !!! 

Wir hatten drei verschiedene Eisbecher ... und alle haben unsere Erwartungen um ein Vielfaches übertroffen. Und auch das Eis selbst ist richtig toll. 

Zudem: ein superschneller und sehr freundlicher Service.

Nur eine Anregung: 
Die Eisbecher sind auf der Karte seeeeehr sparsam beschrieben. 
Für Neukunden wäre etwas mehr Info hilfreich.
Ist aber anscheinend sowieso egal, welchen man bestellt, weil ... siehe oben: alle superlecker.
